intro: Montolivaea aethiopica, commonly known as the Ethiopian ivy, is a climbing plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its berries are bright red and contain seeds that are dispersed by animals. Montolivaea aethiopica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
